(46) 52.lUh February, 1946.CABINET.OFFICIAL COMMITTEE ON SOUTH-EAST ASIA (FOOD SUPPLIES).Note by the Secretary of the Cabinet.THE Prime Minister has directed that a Committee of officials shall beappointed to concert action by United Kingdom Departments with a view to increasing the supplies of rice and other food-stuffs from countries inSouth-East Asia.2. The Committee will be composed of representatives of the following-Departments : iMinistry of Food. Burma Office.Foreign Office. War Office.Colonial Office. Board of Trade.India Office. Ministry of War Transport.Representatives of the Treasury, the Ministry of Supply and other departments will be invited to attend meetings at which matters affecting them are to bediscussed.3. The Committee will work under the supervision of Lord Nathan (acting in a personal capacity and not as Parliamentary Under-Secretary of State forWar), who will report cn behalf of the Committee to the Prime Ministersmeetings on Food Supplies. Lord Nathan will appoint a Deputy Chairman to preside at meetings of the official Committee which he*does not himself attend.4. The Secretariat of the Committee will work in the Cabinet Office, underthe direction of Mr. E. A. Armstrong.5. This Committee will co-ordinate all action by United kingdon departments on communications with the Special Commissioner for South-east asia which are concerned with food problems and related economic questions in South-East Asia.E. E. BRIDGES.Cabinet Ojfice, S.W.1,19th February, 1946.[31328]
